newsitem.title: USA: Nasdaq hits new high on small cap strength.
newsitem.headline: Nasdaq hits new high on small cap strength.

text.p: Nasdaq shares hit a new high before the Memorial Day holiday as strength in several small capitalization issues and networking stocks offset losses in disk drive makers, traders said.
The Nasdaq composite gained 17.12 points or 1.25 percent on Friday to close unofficially at 1389.72, surpassing the previous record high of 1388.06 set on January 22.
The Russell 2000, a key index of small capitalization stocks, gained 4.21 point to a new high of 375.67.

"There's been some gains in some small cap names. People have gotten caught in a short squeeze. They got caught short and there was some buying as they tried to square everything up before the holiday weekend," one trader said.
Advancing issues beat declining issues 2506 to 1623 on total volume of 548 million shares.
Despite gains throughout much of the technology sector, stocks of disk drive companies continued their decline after two brokerages cut their estimates on Seagate Technology Inc, traders said.
Parametric Technology Corp slipped 3 to 44-3/8 after the company said it is comfortable with fiscal 1998 earnings estimates that were less than some expectations.
